name: Grilled Cubanos
description: Fourteen pounds of pernil inevitably produced some leftovers, so what to do with that extra roast pork? Cubanos, of course! A sandwich of sandwiches, the double dose of pig combined with cheese, pickles, and mustard created and explosion of flavor and texture that tasted like perfection.
recipeIngredient: Cast iron sandwich press or a brick wrapped in heavy duty foil

recipeInstructions.text: Light one chimney full of charcoal. When all the charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and spread the coals evenly over the charcoal grate. Clean and oil the grilling grate. Place the sandwich press or brick on the grill to heat up.

Slice the bread in half and spread mustard on both pieces. Assemble the sandwiches by laying down a few slices of ham, then roast pork, cheese, and pickles. Put the sandwich on the grill, placing the press or brick on top. Grill until the sandwich is flattened, the bread is crusty, and the cheese is melted. Remove from the grill and serve.
